docs.lead_paragraph: AFTER more than 20 years as a superintendent, Dr. Art Merz will retire in September at the age of 57 from the Mount Laurel School District to do consulting work and -- equally important -- improve his golf game. In Moorestown, just down the road, Dr. Vito Germinario, 53, has come to the same decision. He plans to retire in July and marry in September, then teach college and ''have a personal life.''

headline.main: Taking the Super Out of Superintendent

docs.abstract: Article on New Jersey school superintendents, who are retiring in record numbers, in their mid- to late-50's; Fund for New Jersey report predicts that 50 percent of state's superintendents will retire in next five years; 10 pecent of 600 superintendents in state are new hires; Educational Research Service study has found that, of those questioned, half consider their jobs very stressful; photos (L)
